page.title: 08THE LANDSCAPE OF GRAFTON
page.content: This is a country area, the southern part of which includes the Avon valley where the river makes a large meander around flat land. To the north of the meander the land starts to rise. By the river the ground is 35m above sea level and it rises to 98m above sea level near Temple Grafton. On the slope of these hills are three mixed woodlands. A small stream rises in Temple Grafton and flows to join the river Avon at Hillborough. Along the stream there are a few ponds close to Grafton Court. There is a beautiful view to the south from Temple Grafton of the Cotswold Hills. At the beginning of this century the area was noted for its good orchards and many of them are still here.There is an old quarry in Temple Grafton, and another in Binton. Stone from these quarries was used for building locally.
